company_context: Docker: Accelerated Container Application Development Search Sign In Get Started Toggle menu A safer container ecosystem, for everyone Free hardened images give every developer a trusted starting point, with enterprise options for SLAs, compliance, and extended lifecycle security. Start building with DHI Download Docker Desktop Download for Mac – Apple Silicon Download for Mac – Intel Chip Download for Windows – AMD64 Download for Windows – ARM64 Download for Linux Security MCP Agents Containers Near-zero CVE images, now accessible to everyone Open-source, Apache 2.0–licensed images built for trust while delivering near-zero CVEs, complete SBOMs, and SLSA Level 3 provenance. Upgrade to DHI Enterprise for SLAs, customization, and compliance, with extended lifecycle support for EOL images available as an add-on. Learn more about Docker Hardened Images Apache 2.0 freedom Docker Hardened Images are fully open source and free to use, share, and build on, with no licensing surprises and complete transparency. Minimal and distroless images Ultra-minimal distroless Debian and Alpine images that remove everything you don’t need, shrinking footprint and attack surface by up to 97%. Up to 95% CVE reduction Eliminate vulnerabilities before they reach production with continuously rebuilt images from Docker’s hardened pipeline and verified SBOMs. Extended Lifecycle Support for long-term protection Add-on protection after upstream support ends, with multi-year CVE patches, updated SBOMs, and verifiable provenance that eliminate long windows of unpatched risk. Start secure, customize easily Add your own tools, packages, certificates, or settings while inheriting Docker’s hardened pipeline, signed builds, and secure defaults. 1000+ images and applications Continuously growing catalog of FIPS and STIG ready languages, frameworks, databases, application images and Helm charts, all signed and verified with SLA-backed security. The easiest, most secure way to run MCP for your LLMs Docker MCP makes it easy for AI agents to securely call MCP servers. Run verified MCP servers as containers and leverage Docker’s built-in security, isolation, and reliability. Explore 250+ MCP servers All your MCP tools in one place Search, deploy, and safely connect to hundreds of tools, in seconds. Docker handles setup, authentication, and security so you can focus on building agents, not managing them. Connect instantly to clients such as Claude and Cursor with one-click setup and no dependency conflicts. Security you don’t have to think about Automatically stop emerging threats like Rug Pulls and Tool Poisoning. Define and run agents, models, and tools with Docker Compose. Orchestrate you

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, my name is Alex and I'm a Sales Development Representative at DeepData AI. I came across your company and noticed you're using Docker for container application development. I'd like to introduce you to our data processing solution that can help optimize your data workflows.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (skeptical) Oh, another data processing solution. What makes yours so special? We already have a few tools in place, and I'm not sure we're looking to add another vendor to our stack.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand your concerns. Our solution is designed to work seamlessly with Docker and can help reduce data processing time by up to 70%. We've had success with similar companies in the industry, and I'd love to show you a demo to see if it's a good fit for your team.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (objection) That sounds interesting, but we're in the middle of a big project right now, and I'm not sure we have the bandwidth to take on something new. Plus, I'm not sure if our team would be willing to pay the premium for another tool.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand that timing and budget are always concerns. However, our solution is designed to be scalable and can be implemented in phases, so we can work with your team to prioritize the most critical areas first. As for pricing, we offer a tiered pricing model that can accommodate different budgets. I'd be happy to discuss this further and see if we can find a mutually beneficial agreement.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (objection) I'm still not convinced. We're already using some open-source tools, and I'm not sure if we need a proprietary solution. How does your solution integrate with our existing tech stack, and what kind of support do you offer?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Our solution is designed to be modular and can integrate with a variety of open-source tools. We also offer comprehensive support, including onboarding, training, and dedicated customer success managers. I'd be happy to provide case studies and references from other customers who have successfully integrated our solution with their existing tech stack.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (objection) Okay, I think I've heard enough. To be honest, I'm still not sure if this is the right fit for us, and I don't want to commit to a demo without getting buy-in from our engineering team. Can you send me some more information, and we can discuss this internally?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Absolutely, I can send you a follow-up email with more information, including case studies and a brief overview of our solution. However, I want to make sure I understand your concerns correctly. Would you be open to a brief call with our engineering team to discuss potential integration points and address any technical questions they may have?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (firmly) No, I don't think so. We're not interested in pursuing this further at this time. We have too many other priorities, and I don't see the value in adding another vendor to our stack. Thank you for reaching out, but I think we'll have to pass.

analysis.raw:
Score: 4
Outcome: Failure
Key_Objection: Integration
Feedback: The seller should have more aggressively addressed the buyer's integration concerns and provided more concrete examples of successful integrations with similar companies to build trust and credibility. Sentiment: Negative

parsed.feedback: The seller should have more aggressively addressed the buyer's integration concerns and provided more concrete examples of successful integrations with similar companies to build trust and credibility. Sentiment: Negative
